title: Belarus banned from Eurovision over song lyrics
description: The country has been disqualified for twice fielding songs deemed to have broken competition rules.

title: Liberty Steel: 'If we lose the plant it will decimate Rotherham'
description: As Liberty Steel scrambles to re-finance the business, steel workers fear for their future.

title: Why there are more chances to see the Northern Lights
description: Activity on the sun, crucial for generating the charged particles we see in the sky as the aurora, is now on the increase . Our BBC Weather Watchers have grabbed some great shots of the recently and there could be more opportunities in the coming years as solar activity increases. Simon King finds out more.

title: The boy who spent a year in a tent for charity
description: Eleven-year-old Max is nearing the the end of his fundraising year camping in a tent in his garden.

title: Batley school protests: The issue of depicting the Prophet Muhammad
description: Why does the use of images of the Prophet Muhammad cause offence?

title: What does Alex Salmond's new party mean for the election?
description: The return of Alex Salmond to the political fray will send a shockwave through the Holyrood campaign.

title: Slight Covid uptick in older school children in England
description: Latest figures from the ONS hint at an increase in years 7 to 11 in schools in England.

title: Asda workers win key appeal in equal pay fight
description: Supreme Court rules shop workers are free to pursue fight to gain equal pay with warehouse staff.

title: Uighurs: China bans UK MPs after abuse sanctions
description: Five MPs are among nine Britons targeted by China after the UK took action over human rights abuses.

title: Jackie Weaver: 'End virtual council meetings? Dreadful idea'
description: The council officer says more people get involved with council meetings when they take place online.

title: Batley Grammar School: Prophet Muhammad cartoon row 'hijacked'
description: Robert Jenrick defends the right of teachers to "appropriately" show images of the Prophet Muhammed.

title: Coronavirus: Germany tightens borders amid alarm over pandemic
description: There could be 100,000 infections a day if the third Covid wave spreads unchecked, Germans are warned.

title: Verstappen fastest in first practice at Bahrain Grand Prix
description: Red Bull's Max Verstappen is fastest in the first practice session of the new season at the Bahrain Grand Prix.

title: Burglar and victims become friends through rehabilitation scheme
description: Anne Linton and a man who burgled her swap Christmas gifts and he regularly does her gardening.

title: Xinjiang cotton: Western clothes brands vanish as backlash grows
description: Companies including H&M and Nike are targeted for showing concern over Uighur forced labour claims.

title: Braunton boy sleeping outside invites children on 'big camp-out'
description: Max Woosey, 11, is inviting children around the world to join him in a camp-out on Saturday night.

title: Fit-again Hunter to captain England in Women's Six Nations
description: Sarah Hunter returns from an injury lay-off to captain England in the Women's Six Nations, which starts against Scotland on 3 April.

title: Rhea birds running wild on Hertfordshire housing estate
description: The flightless birds are reported to have attacked dogs and are being compared to the Road Runner.

title: Prince Albert II: Harry and Meghan interview 'did bother me'
description: Prince Albert II of Monaco has weighed in on the controversial interview that Prince Harry and Meghan Markle gave to Oprah Winfrey.

title: Rough sleepers: Long-term housing 'varies by area'
description: Some people have been housed after years on the streets, but others still face uncertainty.

title: Liverpool City Council gave contract to mayor's son’s company
description: The firm run by Joe Anderson's son was not on an approved contractors list, a critical report found.

title: From 'a kid with no luck' to the verge of history - Ngannou's remarkable journey to UFC title fight
description: Francis Ngannou says he wants to "prove anything is possible" as he looks to become the UFC's first African-born heavyweight champion in Stipe Miocic rematch.

title: World Cup 2026: Are USA building towards success on home soil in 2026?
description: With a thriving system producing players for various Champions League teams, the US look set to be a threat in the 2026 World Cup they will co-host.

title: Bahrain GP: George Russell says he can win races in the right car
description: Britain's George Russell says he has proved he can fight for world titles and wants a car that will allow him to do that.

title: The unusual death of Colin Marr
description: The police said he took his own life after a row with his fiancée - but his family say questions still remain about how he died.

title: Wockhardt UK: Inside the factory making the AstraZeneca vaccine
description: BBC Breakfast has been given a world-first look inside the Covid vaccine factory Boris Johnson called "the saviour of humanity".

title: Mina Smallman: 'I know what Sarah Everard's parents are experiencing'
description: Nicole Smallman and Bibaa Henry's mother says the loss of her children left her "broken beyond words".

title: The Papers: UK 'plans October booster jab' and pub passport 'fury'
description: People being offered boosters to protect against new Covid strains features on Friday's front pages.

title: Coronavirus and shielding: 'I've only left my home five times this year'
description: Michaela Hollywood led a jet-set lifestyle until coronavirus hit, then she had to shield.

title: Learning to code 'will seriously change your life'
description: Software developers are in high demand and well paid, but how do you break into the industry?

title: US immigration: The suffocated youth unafraid of a perilous journey
description: Tougher policies and deaths on the road are unlikely to stop Guatemalans from trying to reach the US.

title: Promising Young Woman: Carey Mulligan film 'deeply troubling'
description: Promising Young Woman, starring Carey Mulligan, is a dark and twisted take on "hook-up culture".

title: Bangladesh at 50: Why my ancestral home could be lost to climate change
description: As Bangladesh turns 50, a UK-Bangladeshi reflects on how climate change affects his parent's country.

title: 999 response officers receive extra psychological support
description: Police forces are offering extra psychological support to 999 response officers.

title: Winslet's same-sex role 'simply a love story'
description: Oscar winning actress Kate Winslet’s latest role sees her as the 19th century fossil hunter Mary Anning.

title: Covid rules: What is the rule of six in England?
description: The rule of six is back for England from Monday but with some changes - we explain what they are.

title: 'My brother died fighting for Senegal’s youth'
description: Thousands of young people took to the streets earlier this month, in anti-government protests.
